channel.title: This Section Is Going Dead... {Read}
channel.description:
Ok, As I mentioned this section is going dead. Let's keep it alive! Just post your tutorials. Ask for help, And give help. Just a little bit of effort could make this section come back from the dead.
Thanks Cabby :)

item.title: This Section Is Going Dead... {Read}
item.dc:creator: @Starblaster100 Starblaster100
item.description:
@Starblaster100 wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:10, topic:69419”][quote author=Starblaster100 link=topic=102004.msg1054376#msg1054376 date=1174947259]
^^ same

I’m starting to use tutorials in this section more and more now, i would appreciate anyone who can write some good php tutorials for me

Thanks
[/quote]
could you be a bit more specific about “some good php tutorials” ? :)[/quote]

A php tut on a few techniques that you all find useful when designing websites, but things i probably dont know about (and i dont know about a lot of things in php, im a complete novice)

Like, i just learned how to use arrays and block IPs from sites.
How to get data from the URL and use it
How to get data from a form and use it
How to get information from a file and post it up on a website.

Gimme some cool tricks that you all know, and please describe them with as much detail as possible

Also, combining some php tuts with mysql would be nice too (and HTML)

Thanks

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Tbh, unless you can make a better, more interactive guide than that of w3schools, don’t bother posting. Tuts are overrated anyway. Post php/html/js code snippets that are useful, but not obtrusive.
